support_summary: A3IP (Ataxin-3-interacting protein) was identified as a novel interactor of ATXN3. [5]

functions.cellular_process: A3IP (Ataxin-3-interacting protein) was identified as a novel, direct interactor of ATXN3.
functions.effect_description: The specific function of A3IP and the consequence of its interaction with ATXN3 are not yet characterized. The discovery of this interaction opens new avenues for understanding the broader cellular network in which ATXN3 operates.
biological_consequence: ATXN3 binds to A3IP → A novel protein complex is formed → Unknown cellular function is modulated
specific_effects: A3IP is a direct binding partner of ATXN3.

mechanism: A3IP (Ataxin-3-interacting protein) was identified as a novel, direct interactor of ATXN3.
effect: The specific function of A3IP and the consequence of its interaction with ATXN3 are not yet characterized. The discovery of this interaction opens new avenues for understanding the broader cellular network in which ATXN3 operates.
summary: ATXN3 interacts with A3IP to modulate protein complex formation, ultimately affecting unknown cellular function is modulated.
